viljfhlp6eOgmHl5uOrnlQ.text: Walked into August Henry's City Saloon at 8:30pm on a Saturday night, August 3rd, 2011.  We were turned away and was told the kitchen had closed.  Wouldn't think with business and attitudes like that, would be around too long.

B_bOXBIddVkcLlT4YUH3QQ.text: Interesting beers on tap and by the bottle, a full service, friendly bar.  Food is a little more than "bar food", with a full menu.  Sweet potato french fries are a must for me, very good.  Living nearly across the street from Henry's, I've been quite often.    Food is hot and fresh.  Service is fast and friendly in the dining area and bar.  They have some creative dishes but they are not consistently executed.  Stick with classics and you won't be disappointed.  Fried Pierogies are very tasty with a Harp beer.

lenzPBZ5dlViC65-YR8Jkg.text: Good solid, a little above average bar food. Not worth going out of your way for, but if you're right there and If you can't get into Tonic...well, it will be acceptable.  Eh.

pSOVCNPEQ7f3BR32bjwQLw.text: Average food for average price. We had pasta, a burger, and cordon bleu. The food was good but nothing to write home about. However, if I were in downtown again and wanted to pay $16 for an entree instead of $30, I'd probably go back. It's worth the price.

LTlQpE5ri8soErroC33V9Q.text: Originally stopped here for just a beer before moving on, but we ended up staying for a few rounds and had some wings. The wings were 50/50: the drums were overcooked, but the wings were fine. Good atmosphere, and a decent beer selection. Seemed to have some of the better prices compared to the other places in the area.

GRlia0ktjQo2Miaq73VT8Q.text: A party of 3 went there last night with 5:45 reservations; a table of 3 females were sat approximately 5-6 minutes AFTER we were sat and we were still waiting on service. When I made the reservations I stated we had tickets for Wicked at 7:30 and the male on the phone said that would not be a problem - he was WRONG! After finally getting John our server he took our drink and appetizer order and went to the females just sat; took their drink order - then proceeded to provide their drinks; took their dinner order THEN took care of our table! He was told that we too were going to Wicked (yep the 3 females also  told him as we could clearly hear them when they arrived that they were going to Wicked).  We told him we'd go ahead and take our salads prior to the appetizer - no protocol due to the timing of the situation; we received our food at 6:50! - he apologized for the delay - needless to say the other party had already long had their dinners and were paying their check! The food was OK; nothing to write home about - our bill for 3 people was $112 and we were treated in such a manner! We tried them because they ADVERTISE as a pre-event spot but trust me do NOT go there; you won't have time to eat and digest your food; what a disappointment with the dining experience - TOO many good places to have this type  of situation happen ever!  I tried to contact them today to let a manager know but alas he was too busy to come to the phone and their is no Contact us on their website.  Good luck to them - I plan on posting our experience and advising others to make sure they plenty of time and you are NOT going to a show. Oh and did I forget they advertised on their website the Tuesday special as $4.00 house wine; however we were charged $6.00 a glass - sad, sad series of events!

KpZFZUXwri8HZj3-P1rSyA.text: Stopped in for dinner.Had the brisket sandwich. It was good.  Stopped in on a rainy Monday evening,was not crowded at all.

dabElUpin0leFWUk129h_w.text: What can I say this is my first stop in the BLACK N GOLD CITY! Beer is cold the bartenders are what you would expect from a city with attitude! Lol I did not say RUDE but they have a whatever tude. To the food BURGERS are above average, wings are spot on! Order them Cajun rub with a sauce of your choice on the side this way they stay CRISPY CRISPY! Now to my favorite the underly devilish  pillows of heaven!  the holy grail to the burg ! What puts the P in Pittsburgh ! The Perogi ,the half order is enough to fill you the whole order is a sharing plate or a ticket back to your room for a NAP! They are Crisp on the outside hot moist and creamy in the middle,  ask for extra grilled Onions  and you will sure to be more than pleased. Next time you find yourself on PENN pass on the trendy micro brew joints and give this place a shot !

Nk6AfBgAmdGz-BOD7oZEYQ.text: Busy sports pub with a larger then normal menu.  Staff is friendly and made us feel like home.  There are TVs at the bar area, note that many of the tables in the dining area cannot see the TVs.  Do not get a seat near the kitchen.  I ordered the Sweet Potato Chicken Dinner.  The chicken is suppose to be topped with an Armaretto cream sauce.  What I got was about a dollop (albeit a small dollop) of a white foam.  I could not tell what flavor the foam was.  The chicken was tender and juicy... The shredded sweet potato crust was crispy and gave a good contrast to the chicken.  The steam veggies is nothing to write home about... Frozen assorted veggie steamed... I had to add salt to get flavor.  The mini baked potatoes were tender...cannot go wrong with them.  I ordered the side Caesar salad... Good croutons.  Lettuce was drowning in dressing and cheese.  Men's restroom was clean and well stocked.  There were 2 standees and 1 stall.

DoDlO-a_JmZkoXP4U2wVxQ.text: Absolutely delicious. Can't put it any better than that. I purchased a BBQ Brisket Sandwich and it was beyond what I expected. Every bite was better than the last and when I was done with it, I was sad I didn't have another nearby.  Everything we ordered came perfectly and I can't really single out any issues. I will without question order from them again.

F84IihSGfaeuZtvROGMWEA.text: As a fairly ordinary, everyday restaurant in the sea of swank that gets all of the attention in the city's downtown dining scene, August Henry's tends to fly a bit under the radar, though it shouldn't! It's in a prime location on Penn Avenue, close to the Convention Center, several hotels and the Cultural District. It offers a giant menu that has something for everyone and the quality of the food is darn good and at a fair price, as are the drinks. The atmosphere is comfortable and unpretentious and the service is prompt and friendly. If you find yourself in downtown wanting something other than a small plate, taco or the latest locally-sourced food craze, this place towers above the other more conventional options in the Golden Triangle.

photos.caption: Photo of August Henry's Burger Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beef Short Rib Mac &#39;n Cheese with mushrooms (a daily special, not a regular menu item).

DVPfKULYGKVnmNVjie17sA.text: I have to admit I wasn't very adventurous. I had a cup of loaded potato soup and a 1/2 club sandwich but it was good. Nothing super outstanding but a good solid lunch. The Pittsburgh pierogies were excellent. Service was fine. Prices were reasonable. All in all a decent place. No big bells or whistles but good for everyday.

v5NqPbUIQVqnbxcwoDXj7A.text: Okay, let's be clear; I'm not a random 5-star giver.  But I'm not a jerk so I try to be fair and helpful to the other Yelpers out there :-)  This place is a very nice watering hole, local feeling tavern/bistro with a local flavor, good food and good service.  My sweetie and I were in town (from New Orleans) with about 3,000 geezers at a woodworking symposium at the Lawrence Convention Center and stayed at the Westin.   I made reservations (I'd recommend it) for Friday at 6:30 PM.  The place was packed.  We were seated immediately.  The server arrived immediately. She was very nice, obviously experienced and efficient and helpful.    We had  a couple of appetizers:  mild wings and zucchini strips with horseradish sauce, and for meal we ended up eating pirrogies.  Yes, the appetizers were that big.  Also, we were drinking just a tad.  The margaritas passed the wife test and I'll mention the beer later.  The zucchini strips were ginormous and tasty.  Crunchy and the sauce was a good accompaniment to them.  The wings were pretty much standard Buffalo style but very good and not too hot.  The pierogies were just as good as I remember from my Chicago days, where my best friend's mom would make some when our band was practicing down in the basement. :-)  The beer "All in Amber" is a local brew.  It is fantastically good.  I'm a sort of beer snob but not one of those hipster wannabes, just to let you know.  But seriously, this is a smooth, rich and creamy amber with a full flavor.  Love me some Amber.  Also, if you're a beer nerd, they have Beer Nerd stats on the bottle.    Highly recommended.

MjA6D34JQIJUBcargTFFdg.text: Had lunch here twice. The half sandwich and soup deal is great. The crab bisque was very good. The blackened catfish po' boy was really. First time I had that. I'm looking forward to going back and trying new menu items.

PQKxnaxvgC4FZK8fgC08OA.text: We ordered 4 burgers and 2 apps bill $120 without tip. Burgers very good. But the menu is False - "craft blue cheese" was literally out of a bottle. Atmosphere not good.

GvZf-euaTenPcTIEdQAkhA.text: Three of us went for dinner before a show.  We were seated immediately and had a great waitress.  The Moscow Mule and Dirty Ketel cocktails were delicious.  We ordered the zucchini appetizer and it was huge!  Very tasty, too.  We got the Blackened Bleu burgers and the 57 Burger.  Everything was done right and tasted great!  We'd definitely go back.

iCMJOrYMIzp3SyeavXaBIQ.text: Nice bar and a good place for lunch. The service was good. I had the California Chicken Club and it was nice to see an actual chicken breast. I just wish there was a little more avocado cream because the chicken was a little dry. The fries were good too. I'll definitely be back.

59DUkV2xmuY-THaiP0AR7w.text: Food and service were great on NYE. We were seated right away and everyone was nice and upbeat. Drinks, appetizers, and meal was all delicious.

5KASq6W_fxB3ZHoed2etmQ.text: Over the last 2 weeks, I have bussed down to Penn Avenue in the heart of what many Pittsburgher's know as 'The Cultural District' to enjoy dinner with old friends. BOTH times, the meeting spot was supposed to be Sienna Mercato.  Busy with a waiting list, we ended up landing next door for dinner at August Henry's City Saloon.    Upon entry to August Henry's, we got a seat right away.  This American pub is located between two newer restaurants that are getting a lot of buzz as Downtown Pittsburgh destinations: Ten Penny and the abovementioned Sienna Mercato.  With unique ambiance decorating both establishments, I truly believe you are paying for the name vs. the quality experience I had at August Henry's.    While dining at August Henry's, friends and I enjoyed sandwiches and salads with drinks from the bar.  On visit one, I devoured a Steelworker burger, complete with a sizable beef patty, sauteed onions and a pierogie.  As decadent as this was, I psyched myself into having a side salad with balsamic dressing in order to feel better about myself.  The second visit was equally enjoyable, as I ordered the popular Sweet Potato Chicken Salad as my entree.  It was sooooo good.  Washing this all down with Vodka and soda on a warm summer evening made for the best cocktail choice (and they have a generous pour I might add).  Even though this restaurant is not new, I had never been to it before the restaurants mentioned above along the Pittsburgh - Penn Avenue corridor.  Yes, that means August Henry might be the overflowing second choice to the newer options, but I truly did enjoy this staple and hope that it sticks around for years to come.

dFDZR6qKVGsJqLAlZH_inw.text: Let me say I have eaten here for lunch and thought it was good. Now I came down here to eat before a Penguins game and they have no game or happy hour specials other than a house wine, seriously?   With that said the service was good, but I was really surprised by the above. I guess I will find a new place before games.

qOyYujSFGXqn33MyuQlH1Q.text: Drinks were just ok. We only had an appetizer so I cannot comment on their entrees,but Their crab cake app is incredible!! Perfectly lumped sweet crap and very little filler.

5OoDk5Zc2N_pB_C7IAcSGA.text: Now I must say the wings were delicious. Whenever I ordered though I asked for a side of sweet potato waffle fries that are prominently advertised all over their menu. The waitress tells me, we don't have those anymore. So I'm like ok, I'll go with some regular fries. Now all the food comes out and the fries are still not there. I ask her once and she says the fryer is backed up give me a minute. About 15 minutes later we ask our waitress again and she says oh my I'm sorry let me check. Another 10 minutes later still none. We ask waitress for the check and she says your fries haven't come yet,  I replied it's ok you can take them off no worries, now she leave and the fries come after we are all done eating and the fries are still on the bill. Poor customer service. Unpleasant experience

Vvx8T8oXp_IpZ3ybYQlYGw.text: Decent burger, sides were frozen (as far as the fries and onion rings go), burger patties weren't made in house(also frozen), and the "brioche" bun was far from authentic.   During my time here a bug landed in my ipa, i was given another without question and had the first removed from my tab. Good service.

SJmHG6Gqlh1xolSuoPgqdQ.text: Menu looked great with lots of options for a family of 5, but not impressed with food or staff. We were greeted quickly by a smiling hostess, but after we were seated we noticed that she just sat on her chair and played on her cell phone while our cups sat empty. Our waitress was busy, but was pretty attentive when she got a moment.   We started with appetizer. Potato skins were good, but standard fare. Expected tastier for $10. We also tried chicken dip which was great! Creamy and spicy, but unfortunately the chips were stale. My husband had Caesar salad and thought it was very good. The rest of us did not enjoy our meals. The pizza was undercooked, the French Dip was tough and tasteless, the house salad was plain with just cucumber and croutons, and the chicken Quesadilla was dry.    The atmosphere is nice, but unfortunately the food was not. Service was mediocre. The 'bus boy" was the most courteous and kept our table clean.

SN6MubxX1_32M2Yz6zTHVA.text: I'm hoping we went on an "off" day. My husband and I popped in yesterday right before we were heading to the airport to go home. The burgers were blah and we were definitely bothering the bartender. The profanity and gossiping that was going on between the waitstaff was nauseating. If I finally waved her down for our check. Maybe the burgers would've tasted better if the bar was more inviting...

poKKvCIrDcprg0ZD61cg6A.text: This is a unique review for me because I really can't go too in-depth about the food...what we ordered was delicious, but it is all a blur! We were running very late for our 6:30 reservation and were going to see a show at the Benedum at 7:30. We were seated and ordered right away.   Jeff was such a wonderful server! He took care of us very quickly, brought our check over right away and even informed the kitchen about our rush to get to the show.   My friend and I split a Tuna Steak Burger and a Sweet Potato Chicken Salad. Both of them were good, I wish I would have had more time to enjoy the food! I was honestly still chewing when we ran out the door to the show. I didn't think the prices were too bad for the portions we received...$13 for the burger and $12 for the salad... but most of their dinner entrees ranged from $20-30.  I would definitely give this place another try when I have a little more time to savor my meal!

qkcdDNyIiCrvZ5osj8tdXw.text: Local person recommended this place We sat at the bar at 2p not busy. The service was terrible The female bar tender was short rude, food was terrible  we ordered fish n chips and Catfish po boy Never go there again

lpCzW9ZXPxEh3gtOuNXR0Q.text: I ate here for a birthday dinner this weekend.  We did have a group of 10 which always poses a challenge.   Our server Marie was GREAT!  She handled us with ease.  The bartenders however were very slow and it took 15 minutes to fill our bar order which was 4 mixed drinks and 4 beers, pretty basic.    We ordered a bunch of apps, buffalo dip, zucchini, stuffed pretzel, and artichoke dip.  the pretzel wasn't anything to write home about, the fried zucchini was the best of the 4, the buffalo dip was good (not as good as my homemade version).  For my entree I had the sirloin steak with piergories.  It was okay, the steak was cooked prefectly, but the pierogies were awful.  That's the reason I got that entree because it came with them.  I would go back to this place for drink and app specials, ($6 Long Islands on Saturday and $6 buffalo Dip) if I wanted to catch a game, (they have a lot of TV's).

GYxRm2JWuYjLTur0y0X7Cw.text: Welcoming atmosphere.  Diverse menu.  Didn't have one of their HUGE hamburgers ... next trip.  The cream of asparagus soup was warm, creamy & lots of asparagus.  My salmon was a nice sized portion.  The prime rib was cooked to perfection.  The grilled chicken salad had lots of spring greens.  3 of us ate (with a wine and southern comfort) for $86.   Great price in theater district.

hmrrU_BmSMjQAiio2ZFMxw.text: If I could rate on the wings alone it would be five stars for sure. Whatever spice they use on the Caribbean jerk is to die for, the portion is great and they are half off from 4 pm to 9 pm on wednesdays. Check the menu for each daily special, there are some good ones. Additionally, servers are friendly and accommodating, we were actually asked what we wanted to watch at the bar. On the less than positive side, the prices really are a bit steep, and there are single specials without a standard happy hour so it won't necessarily be the spot to go for a long evening of affordable food and drink. Also the mixed drink I had, the Sweet Honey Iced Tea, tasted very watered down. Overall, nice people, great wings, go on Wednesday but maybe pass on a stop here for a pregame, long night or bar crawl.

krPb9vZeskTu8EEngLsA9Q.text: August Henrys downtown is a really great spot for lunch or dinner.  I've never had anything that I didn't enjoy.  Had lunch today with co-workers.  My grilled chicken salad with homemade ranch was delicious.  My one coworker got plain mac and cheese which looked fantastic.  She ate every bite!  Another had a Philly chicken sandwich...so good.  Besides the great food the prices are so reasonable and there is a full bar.  Writing this makes me want to head down for lunch today!

nUFiQgn-mm1BQaPb_ED81A.text: We got the BBQ pulled pork nachos and the cheese wasn't melted and it was not a shareable portionZ waitress was not good ether. Left after appetizers

oW1EvgHyGA2Rk9XZ9zgyEA.text: We were sent here by a local and we're glad we listened. Excellent burgers! Generous portion of buffalo dip and super friendly staff.

xcVCyysKP8VqgV5WohyCGg.text: Ate there before the Eagles concert w/my wife and daughter. The burger I had was excellent and the portion was perfect. It was done just the way I wanted it and it came out hot, which is very important to me. I also had an order of fries which were very good. My wife had a salad w/chicken in which she said was good as well. My daughter ordered a salad and chicken sandwich which she was very satisfied with. She actually couldn't eat all her sandwich because of the portion size being so big and asked for a box to take the rest home. Our server's name was Erin and she was very friendly and took her time to make sure every thing was okay. Tuesday nights was $3.00 off burgers and $3.00 off Miller lite drafts. It was very cozy w/a great atmosphere and not loud like some restaurants which means a lot to my wife and I. We were so impressed we stopped back after the concert for a couple drinks. I'd definitely recommend this restaurant if you like burgers, good food and cold drinks. I'll definitely be back when I'm in Pittsburgh again.

Y446lI6RYZfsuYQRc0BhBA.text: Good happy hour prices and service. Bar was full of locals who were grabbing after work drinks. The staff was friendly and recommended other places around the area.

4OKJz8s5i9wT_c2_u9dCVg.text: This place benifits from being surrounded by great places to eat, but don't be fooled.  When we walked in the hostess was texting and didn't see us. Bad omen. We sat down and I ordered a pint of Guinness. The pint arrived seconds later. Bad omen #2. I never understand when a bartender can't pour a proper pint of Guinness.  I ordered the sweet potato crusted chicken, which sounded promising. My wife got the salmon. The salad that came with my meal was good and the croutons delicious. I could tell they were house made so I was looking forward to my main meal. Alas, It was bland as can be. The sweet potato crust was crispy for sure, but the chicken itself was dry and flavorless. It was topped with an amareto sour cream which was odd and did not compliment the dish at all. My wifes salmon was also bland.  Oh, and when we left the hostess was still texting on her phone . Don't bother going here, there are several great choices literally steps away. I shall not return.

bqxaC3YoBXE9I4lQ6evAtA.text: Great food, great drinks, service not so much...  Came here for happy hour one time with a co worker on a Friday. Once you're able to flag down the waitstaff... Your experience will be great! Had the potato skins and a dirty martini. Their martinis are $6 on Fridays, but made with well liquor- still really good.   Nice portions for the food, and strong drinks! Definitely worth the money. I will be back, I just hope I don't have to wait 20 minutes for service...

gtI-7XFz4MbpNxIaToEB2A.text: We had a great time at this restaurant, first meal in Pittsburgh. Service was great (Erin rocks) and the food and drinks were delish. We had a variety of appetizers- all were eaten quickly by the group! Would recommend the Cajun shrimp mac and cheese for sure.

2nTlO2QPLj9rDRbN69ShxQ.text: Stopped here before a WWE event at PPG Paints Arena, and I was pleasantly surprised.   Beforehand I checked out the other yelp reviews and there were some pretty good ones but also some rather bad ones so I didn't know what to expect.   My experience was great though. Great food, service was perfectly fine but it was a little early that I went so not sure how it is when it picks up a bit. But the food was surprisingly good, looked like they cared about its quality to me. And there was a lot of it. Portions were great.   I saw some ppl complaining about price but what do you expect? First of all, it's way cheaper than most places on Penn. But beyond that, I thought it was priced exactly the same as other American restaurants. A burger is 12 dollars, and a specialty burger is like 15. That's not unbelievably cheap but it's not absurd.   Great place. I would definitely go back and likely will!

L3vSk80_qvhVx2aQeDST_Q.text: Good food and the staff here is awesome, will definately be back. I recommend the chipotle burger

07SUEg-SrJOVzGhjkzE_wg.text: I'll likely get caned (by Bourdain?) for saying this, but sometimes the chains do it better. Max & Erma's makes you a rather juicy, succulent burger when you order one medium-rare. When I ordered a medium-rare burger at August Henry's, I got one that was almost well-done, and to my tastes, there's no other way to order a burger but medium-rare. August Henry's GUS Burger, which like the restaurant itself is named after the proprietor's industrialist great-grandfather, is a smorgasbord between a halved Brioche bun. A whopping pound of aged, ground 100% Angus Reserve Steak commands center stage along with lettuce, tomato, and red onion. I customized mine with bacon, gouda, and a love-biting creole mayonnaise, none of which did much to mask the dryness of the patty. The potato chips, cut and fried in-house, were magnificently crunchy and deftly seasoned, however. Even the best bagged "kettle chips" were no match for these. Our appetizer of zucchini strips paralleled the potato chips pleasantly with their seasoning and crispness, the tart marinara and cool cream of the ranch dressing engaging in gastronomic tennis as we alternated dunking pieces of the vegetable planks in each. Dessert was a fairly unremarkable cut of Chocolate Mousse Cake. Gorgeous to gaze upon, the confection itself lacked the decadence I'd been craving after a brutal week. While I always welcome the inherent airiness of a mousse, which in this case mortared the layers of cake together, the ganache that topped it had no panache, tasting like so much Hershey's syrup. Furthermore, we found the service to be inattentive, impatient, and vaguely inhospitable. Our waitress recited specials to patrons other than us, requests for refilled beverages were ignored, and as the dining room became busier, the more we felt pressured to leave. The snobby clientele also soured my overall experience. Old money? No wonder the decor was so stodgy. The upper-crust needs places in which to slum-it too, and that's fine. I just didn't appreciate our party being glared at by elderly women in Jackie O glasses and their spoiled, adolescent grandsons. Christ, now they're wearing salmon-colored shorts and capri pants in elementary school? Is Armageddon at hand? What should I have expected considering August Henry's heritage? youtube.com/watch?v=E510...

7Bp0EkKGeeHM8gdyV1meVQ.text: We checked in to August Henry's for some dinner while attending an event at the nearby convention center, and the experience was mixed.  August Henry's is laid out like a traditional pub, with a large bar with high-tops and a moderately-sized dining area with standard tables.  Service is extremely friendly, though not spot-on accurate.  There were 5 of us, and our orders ran the gamut of the menu, from obscenely large burgers to vegetarian dishes and salads.  The one common feature that united them all: salt.  Yes, it does seem that the kitchen knows exactly where the salt shaker is... from extremely salty fries, to extremely salty onion rings, to extremely salty chips, to an extremely salty caesar salad, everything is packed with too much salt.  Literally every person said that something on their plate was way too salty.  The food otherwise is decent, though nothing spectacular.  We had to stop our server several times to ask about items that were missing, but they were always quick to correct.  All in all, August Henry's serves serviceable, but ultimately mediocre food crusted in salt, and at fairly high prices relative to the quality of the food.  It's not bad, but it's not all that great, either...

Zg9cdam2pW83ThDamjG8RQ.text: I have eaten lunch at August Henry's several times while working downtown.  The food was always pretty tasty.  I never had an issue of not liking what I ate, but I seemed to always have an issue with getting my food in time to make my hour lunch break not run over.  Even going during off lunch hours (like after 2pm) we have waited 30+ minutes for our fare.  This part I have never been a fan of, especially when several times I was there with a friends and there was literally no one else in the dining area.   The servers though I have never had any particular issues with rudeness or anything, have a very lax perspective to urgency.  I went before with a friend and the bartender/waitress came over to our table about 5 minutes after we sat down for drink orders and disappeared for 25+ minutes after that.  No one at the bar, no one in the dining/bar area.  It felt odd.  When she finally came back our food was still not in sight.  We had to yell across the empty restaurant to get refills.  When she came we asked how long until or food, she said a few minutes.  When she finally did bring our food, sandwiches mind you, about 40+ minutes had passed and we needed to book it back to work.  We asked for our bill and boxes.  So there is that, I don't really recommend coming here if you are on a strict time limit. My last visit here was just for drinks.  My one friend is moving to Houston so we did one slightly crazy night bar hopping and August Henry's was second on the list due to one member of our party holding strong that they have an abundance of beers on tap.  When we got there it was pretty busy.  We luckily found a few seats at the bar and sat down.  It took a while to get anyone to wait on us.  I know it was busy but here is the weird thing.  Me and my husband order while he is getting our drinks my friends are talking about what they want.  He took my card brought our drinks and disappeared!  My other two friends sat without a drink for several minutes before he returned.  Thought that was really not cool, but whatever they weren't upset but I probably would've been if it was me.  So I guess the strangest thing about our short visit that Friday night was that the Pittsburgh Opera Performers were there doing improv opera... :/  Just as we start to drink they begin to belt out some sort of story line, I don't know what it was, it was loud and not enjoyable for me or my friends so we were one and done and onto the next place to continue our night.  I would go back to August Henry's but only if I had a lot of time and probably not for Happy Hour.

OZm0v_vYkeU-y7CCTGNirQ.text: Great service. Delicious new menu! Check this place out!! Solid happy hour 5-7, drinks and food specials.

Aku5cU-AjEhI-Vg6Y5RAPw.text: August Henry's is a regular lunch stop for me downtown. Yes, it's still lent so I once again tried a fish sandwich. I promise I enjoy all types if food. I wanted to share that it can be tough squeezing in lunch here under the traditional 1 hour lunch window. Also anticipate the bill to be closer to $15+ per person and easily could be $20 if you do some add on's.   I went with jumbo fish sandwich and a cup of soup. The soup was a cup of clam chowder and it was "delish!" I could have just eaten a few bowl of that. The fish was breaded and perfectly cooked with a side of chips. I got my ever present coke w cherries added. I recommend this stop if you are lucky enough to work downtown.

photos.caption: Photo of August Henry's Burger Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chipotle Burger. :)
Photo of August Henry's Burger Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Add some cherries to your coke. :)
Photo of August Henry's Burger Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The &#34;chowder!&#34; You have to say it in a Boston accent and act like your sports teams never lose at anything. ;)

_S3HEve3drrJvWNh-yFQ8Q.text: This place is so fun. Even though I don't participate, Fri nites is karaoke and (most) of the people are pretty good. I've gone several times and I've noticed a few 'regulars', which is nice. Its nice to make friends  :-) Its such a mix of different people, I guess the karaoke brings in the love, haha.  One of my fave places to drink and chat

vHB0QatfabvAkJIGimym4g.text: Much like every place in Pitt, they have a lot of fried food on the menu. However, their fried pretzel appetizer is so good you need a defibrillator by your side. The burgers are solid and the service was great. You wouldn't expect it, but they serve a mean martini, complimented with blue cheese stuffed olives.   The long island ice teas served here are amazing and inexpensive. If you ask nicely, you may even get a "to go" cup. It certainly served us well on our walk to the casino.  This place is a highlight in the drab city that is Pitt. If I were unlucky enough to have to live in Pittsburgh, I would make this a regular spot to visit.

RKj53Xy7nPS1iyBoSP-yfw.text: Stopped in for a very late lunch and we were the only ones there. We asked for a beer list and when it came, I was pleased to see a great variety - something for everyone. For food, my husband and I couldn't resist sharing the stuffed pretzel app and it was de-lish! For our entrees I had the sweet potato-battered chicken sandwich, very good but nothing spectacular. The sweet potato fries were delicious. My husband had the fish & chips, which he claimed were "as good as he'd ever had with an awesome dipping sauce."   We'd definitely come back for a casual meal next time we're in the area.

IncYzIxJ45-Nyw5Uo5UE9A.text: This place is just ok.  I went here for lunch and they have a decent size menu, sandwihces, salads, and soup.  The food is just ok and the service is just ok.  I do love their homemade chips and can't seem to ever pass on them.   I ordered the grilled chicken sandwich with pepperjack cheese.  It is served with a side of spiced mayo which is delicious.  I know alot of people order the coconut chicken salad as well.  It seems to be pretty popular.  The waitress didn't seem very pleasant but did the job she was hired to do.  The food was served timely and the drinks were never empty.  My waitress doesn't have to be my friend after my meal.  The ambience tries to resemble an old saloon but it is really just crowded and uncomfrotable.  I go to this establihsment because it is convenient to meet friends and i can usually get a table.  I would reccomend this to someone looking for a quick meal that doesn't care about service or is picky about the menu.

3n6M5-u_SNxvglXF4Eh2sw.text: I've drank at this establishment late at night but never ordered any food. My friend was in town from Seattle and on his last day we decided to do lunch. I figured this was a perfect opportunity to check out the culinary offerings of August Henry's. The menu was available online and looked pretty decent.  We arrived and were seated and waited on by the bartender which is a pretty common practice in mid afternoon at smaller, low volume establishments. My friend ordered an "Italian Burger" and I ordered a double cheeseburger, cooked mid rare. My friend enjoyed his burger, however, he isn't fussy about how a burger is cooked. My burger was not cooked to the temp that I requested. It was well done and dried out. After about 10 minutes and three bites I had to flag the bartender over as she never did a check back after she delivered our food. I sent it back and received a new burger that was juicier but the juices were clear, not red. Obviously, not mid rare. The two patties were 8 oz a piece. Quite a lot of meat however by the time I got half way through the new burger, it had dried out as well. I figured that if they couldn't get it correct in two attempts that a third was a waste of time.   Overall, I found the experience to be pretty underwhelming. It's a shame because the dinner menu looks pretty robust, however, there is no way I am taking a chance on ordering a $25 piece of Ahi Tuna or a $30 filet when twice they failed to properly cook a freakin'  cheeseburger to temp. The bartender who waited on us was polite but not very personable and slightly inattentive. I took half the burger home in a box but later in the evening I just ended up throwing it away.  I honestly can't recommend this place.

Z6qxq_Ckh3ln4Bfo6NsfgQ.text: This pub/restaurant is only a short distance from the Convention Center, Westin, and Courtyard by Marriott, so it is a prime location for food when attending Anthrocon in June. I was in the city for Anthrocon and it just so happened that the dinner group decided to go to August Henry's one night. Anyway, the service was courteous and good. I'm not sure how many people the dining area can accommodate. The section we were in, at least, looked rather small. The food was pretty good too, although priced a bit high for my tastes. I definitely would return, although not as an every-day thing.

photos.caption: Photo of August Henry's Burger Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sweet potato chicken
Photo of August Henry's Burger Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

0EQ1wOZHvnY98722hkvckw.text: We ate at August Henry's before going to the Benedum Theater. We were 20 mins late getting there due to excessive traffic. Our waitress made sure we received our food uin plenty of time. It was prime rib night and it was delicious!! Best prime rib I have ever eaten!!

tTxb6msgrpz71RdWiWYYpA.text: My colleagues and I have been coming here for a few months after quitting our regular weekly lunch place due to inconsistent results.  August Henry's is simply a regular American bar-food joint. The service is very good. The decor is of a somewhat traditional motif but still inviting.  The food is consistent and well-executed. The burgers are properly cooked to order; juicy and nicely sized. You might think that getting a burger done right shouldn't be hard but it's surprising how many mid-range places can't cook exactly to order. The soups are delicious. And the croutons on the salads are fantastic. (Yes, croutons).

p2u9uGNK-HAeWe-CJ5DYZQ.text: I had a four hour wait in Pittsburgh and wanted to get some food. From this one trip I could definitely recommend Henry's. the food was good (I had the French Dip), the staff was super friendly and they didn't kick me out when I waited for my train for an hour after I finished my food. If you're traveling through Pittsburgh and need a quick pitstop for a reasonable price, try Henry's.

QT5AaEzUCAkLnX1YUxMyMg.text: Maybe if the bartender actually did her job instead of talking to her friend on the other side of the bar about renting condos in the city my experience would have been better.  So hungry for potato skins, they had them yeah not good. We couldn't even get a drink again too busy not doing her job!

Ql2RRJcaxkL5IOQRfqsAZw.text: I'm currently in Pittsburgh for business and found myself here tonight. As some others have mentioned, apparently this area is NOT a hot evening spot. I struggled to find something open that looked even remotely appealing, and it wasn't that late at all, about 8pm. So that said, 1.5 of these stars are for the fact that this was close to the Westin Hotel and was open.    The atmosphere: standard. Nothing special whatsoever. Large bar and large dining area.  Service: 1 star for the service. My waiter was very, very nice. (even though he had a strange moustache ... :-p)  Food: It's pretty standard. There is a large menu with pretty average prices. They do have some unique items, but none that I can comment on. I had the Chicken/artichoke/spinach dip with bread triangles. Pretty good, it was also half off for some reason ... making this HUGE plate only $5. I also had a 'side' caesar salad. This was VERY big for a 'side' and was only $2.99! They also have quite a few different beers on tap and in bottles.   In concluson: decent food, pretty darn good prices, great service and is open past 6pm!

4r9VlqiJpsGSWGkrKmJgxw.text: I recently visited Pittsburgh for a weekend and stayed near the convention center. Apparently the area is not a hot-spot for entertainment or dining!   On a Friday night I went looking for a casual bar / restaurant where I could get some eats and hang out for a bit. A quick walk down the "Strip" offered two options: a high-end Italian place and a sports bar that looked more like a nightclub. Fail.   So we wandered over to the "Cultural District" where we were met with more high-end looking restaurants and this place. So we gave it a try.  It automatically gets a point just by being one of the only places open in the area. Otherwise, it didn't stand out, but also didn't offend.  The food was pretty good (I had a crabcake salad, the bf had a burger) and the prices were reasonable. Service was decent. Bar menu was fulfilling - it was even $5 martini night so I couldn't complain.   Doesn't seem like the kind of place you'd go out of your way to try, but if you're in the area it's not a bad pick out of your limited options.

t10la5wVh1UyzdWYqIfaiA.text: Had an unpleasant experience a couple of years ago, but the recent reviews motivated me to give it another try when I was downtown for a ballgame.     Still doesn't work for me.   First, I find the place generally uncomfortable.  The lighting seems to have been retained from the space's former life as some kind of retail outlet.  Harsh and unpleasant.  The whole decor seems disconnected.  The drinks are okay, but the food?  What my buddy and I ate tasted like it was just delivered by Gordon's Food Service and quick-defrosted in a microwave.   Nothing fresh-made, obviously.    MY recommendation?  Walk across the street to Sonoma Grille.  Far better food and a much more comfortable environment for not a whole lot more money.

xKYzFrtSIyeoCyyAAVIw5Q.text: Great little bar and restaurant in the downtown area.  Huge selection of bottled beer.  Everything is moderately priced.  This place is a must if you like the bar scene.  The bartender on Thursday  night was very good. She made sure I never had an empty glass.  She was also very informative when it came to things to do in the city as I will be in town for a few days.  Kudos to her.  She is a great asset to this place and an excellent ambassador to the city.

f-U6Gc6gQr0gtv3PRT1Vbw.text: An employee at the Westin recommended this restaurant.  It was only a short walk from the convention center so, I invited my mother to come along with me.  When I first entered the building, I thought I made a mistake.  There was some kind of odor and the floors where sticky.  The place was not dirty but, I could tell it was a little older and probably needed a little more tlc.  We started our meal with the Crab Cake appetizer.  The crab cakes were more crab than cake.  The big lumps of crab were flaky and delicious.  More than half way through the appetizer, we realized there was sauce too. They were good with or without the sauce.  We both had salads with our entrees.  They have the BEST croutons I ever ate.  My mother went with the waitress's recommendation of the sweet potato chicken, it was not much to look at it when it arrived.  I decided on the Blackened Blue Burger. They seasoned the beef! It was incredible, one of the best burgers I had in a long time.  As we both remarked on how good the food was, I had to try her Sweet Potato chicken.  It was unique, flavorful and tasty.  It came with this Amaretto sauce that made it out of this world.  My opinion of this place totally changed after leaving.

vG7H9YDabW8x0XANNohUkw.text: Ordered take-out from this place and ordered Filet Mignon.  An hour after I place the order I get a call stating that they are out of filet and am asked what I want to do. I asked if I could look at the menu and am told to call back soon because my order is the last one they are taking for the night for take-out (basically hinting that I needed to hurry up). I call back and said I'll get New York Strip and am told I'd have to pay the extra $4....not a huge deal but I would just expect in the name of courtesy they'd waive the $4 fee.  Especially since it took an hour for them to call and tell me this.

hrWzrlYdUkM4JyOyfDKBsQ.text: Food is better than the place looks.  I got a pasta dish that was impressive for a "bar".  They have good bar food too.

iH0vbKno4DLevZAvJ9BHUA.text: I've never had a bad meal at August Henry's and since it's a half a block from my office, I've gotten to sample many things from the menu.  I'm never left feeling hungry either.  The portions are enormous AND delicious.  The fish sandwich is bigger than your head.  The Stromboli is one of the best around.  And the menu is varied enough that every one of your picky, annoying friends and/or coworkers will be satisfied.    The item's appear pricey on the menu, but once you get your food and find yourself struggling to finish the last bite, the 9 bucks you spent on a sandwich is well worth it.    The atmoshere is chill and relaxing.  A great place to have lunch.

vMW8YM-W-INOCeveUufBSQ.text: Stopped in for a quick lunch. The bread they use in their reuben is particularly good.

Mu_hdQqfNW_XOG4vyc5RMw.text: I liked everything about this place. The food was great. I had a Gus burger. Honestly, one of the best burgers I have ever had. The service was friendly and fast, even though it was happy hour.

7wPXYjlPVbdK2Fi2vcaSYw.text: Love this place, bartenders and staff are great and 3 big screens make it the best place in the area to catch a game. Great selection of beers and martinis!

7bbCi0l4elhy7_jbqIRHMA.text: Have been there several times over the years and always enjoyed the food. They have changed their menu to a burger theme since our last visit. We had the wings and they were very good although kind of pricey at $14.99 for 12. $5 for a glass of Yingling is Truely ridiculous. Had the combo half sandwich, chips, and a salad which was very good and worth the price. All in all it was a good experience .

15DSjmvGBnNEehSLrM2y5A.text: They had me at three dollar cocktails and house wines from 5-7pm during their happy hour. I wasn't expecting much from the house wine but the Riesling was all kinds of yummy. I stopped in for a break from the rain and love the atmosphere here. It's a gem amongst a few pricier places. I enjoy the appetizers are flavorful and there's a nice variety to choose from. I also like how pleasant the staff is every time I go. Great customer service is a lost art and goes a long way now a days. They were using half the bar for a holiday party and I didn't feel neglected at all. Definitely check this place out if you haven't already.

aUJ-q3lPmIgAsyEJlnQa2A.text: 3 stars for food, 1 star for service. Had pirogies, buffalo wing dip and burger.  All were good, but nothing spectacular.  Service was extremely lacking.  Wife and I sat at bar and were ignored most of the time, even though there were very few other customers.  Bartender seemed more interested in talking with friends/co-workers than checking to see if we needed another drink or asking how our food was.  Based on food alone, would return if in area again, but factoring in the poor service we'll go elsewhere.

7t1Uh2CVxAWaZIvIINn1yw.text: Turned our party of 10 away. Alternatively, would not take two parties of 5.  Likely because it's happy hour and we had 4 adults with 6 children.  Kids don't drink. On the way out, one of the staff commented "damn it's the Brady Bunch."  We'll take our money elsewhere.  Sharp Edge Bistro took as right away even though they had equally brisk business.

Y0cULqgnIv6a_0oxYsyktw.text: Large portions and great food. Good service. We ate here during the jazz weekend and loved the food.. Will be back asap.

mkOKFHQHDAHZtsY19I-0zA.text: I went with a build your own burger build here with chips. I got my burger medium and it turned out great. Mixing it with the sharp white cheddar and onion strings really brought it together. Oh yeah I also got the pretzel bun so hey try that if you like pretzel bread!

uRYzH1DbWwsVPgl3epL86A.text: My wife and I each had a juicy burger. She had an angus burger with white cheddar cheese and sauteed onions. Mine was the Italian burger consisting of angus burger, hot sausage pattie, tomato, hot pepper cheese and salsa.

gP_4Vj9myYSPIwj_883zxg.text: Really, really good food and great service for a great price.  Try the brisket flatbread - phenomenal.

HaDeUHz5BO9J86agw6VolQ.text: Honestly, this place is super overrated. I've eaten here three times to give it chances, because I really wanted it to be good, but I've been let down all three times. You do not get what the prices are calling for. I've gotten the buffalo chicken salad, the steak salad, a burger and the jalapeno soft pretzels here before. The burger is truly left to be desired and the salads are sad. The burger was sloppy. Although it was big, it didn't excite my tastebuds. And the salads- they're also sloppy and the lettuce was wilted each time. The portion of salad is not very big at all, compared to other places- especially for $15. The jalapeno soft pretzels are the True star, though, as those were super tasty and bumps this up to 3 stars.

M-SGpfH7y8JVLuORIyzb3Q.text: I have enjoyed every meal that I have gotten here.  They give you a drink in a massive cup, so you don't have to worry about getting multiple refills.  The burgers are solid, the green bean fries are delicious, and the service is adequate.  The last time I was there, I got a burger and a glass of wine for under $24 with tip.   My friend got the fish and chips and ate every bite.  Never a disappointment.  A simple, unpretentious, tasty place to eat.

IfnVfsA3Nfal_D4jyz0aqA.text: I didn't even want to give this place a star. We went here last winter before going to a show at The Benedum. When we first walked in, it was busy but not busy to the point that there was a waitlist or crowded. I'd say there were maybe 15 customers there at the most. Our host was nice and seated us right away. Our server started out nice but after we had ordered our drinks, she disappeared for about 15-20 minutes. When she did finally come back, she took our appetizer order and entree order. I had order a small salad that came with my meal and that came promptly. But our appetizer we had ordered took about 30-35 minutes to arrive, and it was cold. And there was also a party of 4 who were seated about 20 minutes after us, and had gotten their main courses before we did. Like I said it was busy but not overly crowded, there were still tables open. Our server didn't check on us at all, and the hostess that had seated us brought our entrees (not our server). My entree was not very good at all, I had had a chicken and pasta dish. My chicken had a funny taste to it, and I didn't like the sauce on the pasta. My boyfriend had a steak Mac and cheese dish, but he liked his. Our server was inattentive and basically disappeared our whole time. In total, we were at the restaurant almost 2 hours. Additionally, the previous table of 4 I had mentioned earlier had finished their meals and left way before we even had gotten our entrees. Since our server was MIA during 90% of our visit, I requested to talk to the manager. He was very polite and apologetic to us and listened to my complaints and respected us. He was nice enough to pay for our entire bill, including our beverages. I have read other reviews for their establishment and have seen a lot more negative reviews than positive. I would not recommend this place on account of the very poor service, with the exception of manager.

FPFdEP0-Rtv_Z40FMYF6KQ.text: The food was just ok - I had a turkey and bacon panini. Nothing to write home about. Kind of had a kick to it with the pepperjack cheese. The food was quite expensive for the quality. I know at night this place turns into a cool bar scene with karaoke.   I came with my Sorority Chapter and they did accomadate for about 20 of us and being such a small space that was pretty cool of them. They were also pretty organized and had our food cooked and ready when we got there. For that they get 3 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of August Henry's Burger Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Zde3uYIW_BFP1mQdUrM8NQ.text: Had lots of fun here last Friday night. We went in late (around 10 pm?) for drinks and karaoke. The bartender was on her game and we were served promptly and generously. After a couple rounds of shots and mixed drinks we moved up to the front of the bar for karaoke. I am generally not a fan, as I have a terrible singing voice, but once others started to sing and the booze kicked in I found it highly enjoyable. We ended up singing (there were 8 of us sharing time with 2 other groups and one individual who was a regular there) for hours (like 3), and had lots of laughs.  The bar itself is dark with lots of wood; bathrooms surprisingly clean; a long bar with seating in the bar area, plus a dining room, and a full menu. We had already eaten but some of the snacky-food coming out of the kitchen looked good though I can't comment on quality or taste.  What I can say is that the folks running the joint want you to have fun and the staff seem to get that message. I recommend going on karaoke night. Hopefully you'll enjoy it as much as we did!

AwBz-Q5ahGCAUDsJZ3aFSQ.text: Wow!  Best burger in ages.  The beef is delicious.  Build A Burger your way is great.  Good prices for the  city. Nice atmosphere too.

l8TgI1bYjNKTkEgD6KZe2w.text: Had the extreme wings, the meat lovers burger and some Yings. The extreme wings are hot. And I love hot food. While eating with the burger the heat was really intense. The meat lovers burger was not what I ordered, however was a welcomed mistake. I ordered the chipotle burger but the runner brought me someone else's burger by accident. Great burger. Well worth the money. You won't go away hungry. The $3 draft specials on Wednesday was a nice plus.

hQxJAitMXWa5Lo3ouOIgFA.text: Verging on being a dive bar, this place ticked nearly all points for me. I love nothing more than a warm, homey, and cozy place when there's a shitty snowstorm outside. While initially comfortable, I'm compelled to remove a star due to the service. It was a little TOO GOOD, in that the bloke waiting on us was totally impatient and frantic.

eJ6JDilMzWZxN3TgFRL3wA.text: Brisket Brisket Brisket...and a beer. Nice bar/restaurant to stop at for lunch and happy hour with coworkers. Good location. Good staff.

6r7od5e1WJswews58wcZIw.text: This place is okay. Not terrible, but not fantastic. There's never anywhere nearby to park, but the staff is always friendly. The food isn't anything to brag about by any means, but it's a clean restaurant and it serves food at decent prices.

ETWsatexb0zQYQn8HR9qxQ.text: Meh. The menu is ok and the staff was nice, but the food seemed to generally disappoint or just be ok. It's a little pricey too. You can't switch out a salad or fries for chips. There is an upcharge. We were thirsty the rest of the evening suggesting everything was overly salted. Nice area of Penn Avenue.

fzLZuVcaA6Zwsip9p2k7jA.text: I was hungry and really didn't have a lot of time to eat lunch.  Plus, I wanted to make sure that I met several friends for lunch.  So far so good with trying to find a place to accommodate that set of restrictions during lunch time.  Not!  We actually had success with the August Henry's City Saloon. I had heard of the place and it's not that far from my office, but I had never ventured there and neither had my lunch companions.  All three of us were starving.  Fa La La La La!  Off we go!  I ordered the Blackened Catfish Po' Boy (Fresh catfish prepared southern style, dusted with Cajun spices and pan blackened. Served on a toasted baguette with lettuce, tomato and creole mayo.  My one lunch buddy ordered the California Chicken Club (Grilled chicken breast topped with pepper jack cheese, lettuce, tomato, crisp bacon, and avocado slices on toasted Brioche bread.) and my other buddy ordered The Steel Worker burger (Signature Saloon burger topped with caramelized onions, cheddar cheese and a Pittsburgh pierogie. Served on a toasted Brioche bun.) He also opted to have an egg added on top of the burger, for an added cost of $1!  We also ordered House Cut Fries and Fried Green Beans to go with our sammies.  Let me tell you something, when the food arrived, it looked like enough food for a small tribe.  The portion sizes were extremely generous and the food was very tasty.  My buddy who ordered the burger said that very few restaurants actually get a burger ordered medium rare right and August Henry's got it right.  Likewise, when ordering blackened catfish, the seasoning is usually overwhelming and the fish overcooked.   August Henry's got the catfish right!  Well-seasoned, without being overly so and moist, I was pleased with my sandwich.  Yummy!  Likewise, my buddy who ordered the California Chicken Club said that he enjoyed his sandwich.  Additionally, our waiter was extremely helpful in identifying popular menu items and Johnny On-It when it came to servicing our table.  It's not a fancy place and it's not cutting edge, but it's a nice neighborhood place where you can get a decent meal and not worry about spilling ketchup on yourself.  Excellent place for lunch.

TdMehTn8jAEMqZYX5lSu8w.text: I have been here multiple times for lunch and dinner.  Overall it is a decent place to get some food and a drink.  Laid back older atmosphere.  Their buffalo chicken dip appetizer is great.  However make sure you have at least at a group of 4 or it will likely be too much if you are eating meals too.  I usually go with a burger here as my meal.  They are above average, but not anywhere near the best joints in town for a burger.  Meat flavor seems to be really lacking and they also have trouble cooking them properly.

q3X7FeRDutRIqaCYDNFWtg.text: Great food and service. They have a make your own burger like burgatory. The burger wasn't the same as burgatory. Burgatory got it down much better. The burger was fine.

photos.caption: Photo of August Henry's Burger Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

qnJo8oomP5hPxZhMsmRYjg.text: Lunch service was pretty ok. I was with a large group so it was a little slower. My favorite thing about this place is the gigantic cups they pour the drinks in.   Food was outstanding in my opinion if you come to a place with burger in the name you expect a solid burger. It was cooked perfectly medium rare. All of the toppings were fresh and crispy. The chips on the side were also pretty good and seemed like they made them in store.    It's expensive because you're in the city but I feel like the proportional value to it was tolerable.

d58Swl4lX_EXnDhizwUxEg.text: This place is magnificent. I'm here right now. Every moment so far has been amazing. The woman who seated us was so pleasant. That woman waiting on us, Michelle, is just so nice and everything came quickly and accurately.  THE FOOD!!! it's so good, I can't even explain how happy I am right now.

obaFzoWGE_b92nNZVfCzdw.text: I came here for a work function. It was busy with large tables, but it didn't seem overwhelming.    I ordered the chipotle burger with sweet potato fries. I'm not sure if the fires were hand cut but they seemed fresh. They were sprinkled sugar, too. They didn't need any ketchup or other sauce. The burger was huge! It was topped with fried onions and the chipotle sauce came on the side. The burger was cooked as I requested. I really enjoyed the meal.   As far as the service, it was slow. Again, I'll give the benefit of doubt and lay blame on the large tables. My co-worker also requested not to have something on her pasta and it was still on there.   I'd return again when they would possible be less busy.

photos.caption: Photo of August Henry's Burger Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chipotle burger

EIRbAkKbmdGNvfW-0mmXTA.text: Food was mediocre. It may not have been a frozen burger but it definitely looked and tasted like one (I got the chipotle burger).  The one major con about the place is the professionalism of some of the servers. The server who helped me was very nice but her co worker was complaining about another table in front of customers! Very unprofessional!

BfnFUHNtEIE1DmmmirBJHQ.text: I went there before dinner just to hang out and watch TV.  They had a few good beer selections and then I needed a snack to hold off the effects of the drinks.  I didn't know what pierogi was, so I thought I'd try a few.  OH my goodness, they were fantastic!  My son met me there and stole the rest of my pierogi so we ordered more with our dinner.  The wait staff was attentive and left us alone until we asked for something.  good place

AjY5YZUgynwEuSviD8321Q.text: Great food at a down home Pittsburgh Establishment. Loved the Prime Rib Dip and tater tots. Mac and cheese bowls were also awesome! Bartender was very helpful with choices.

vDzFfouXQ7BU912bvdvWkA.text: Meat Lovers Burger Our signature Saloon burger topped with Capicolla ham, beef brisket, and bacon. Topped with Gouda cheese, BBQ sauce, and piled high with onion straws. Served on a fresh Brioche bun  Well, thanks to traffic, i missed my Yelp event at Slice on Broadway. So I wanted to try a place I haven't been to. August Henry's City Saloon....damn, what an awesome burger, an instant favorite!!!! Onion Rings on the side, a 5 star burger for sure, cant wait to go back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of August Henry's Burger Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Meat Lovers Burger!!! 5 stars!!!!

Fby_jZtBF1BW4PbgZUDAEQ.text: Nice happy hour, good bar food, overwhelmed staff.   If you are in Downtown Pittsburgh around 5:00 August Henry's has a very good happy hour for drinks: $3 drafts and wine. And drafts on sale where actual beers, not just water...I mean Miller Light! Different food special each night. Only drawback is I wish they had more food specials daily.   Had the Chicken and Waffles for my meal. It was surprisingly good. Chicken was still moist and the waffles stayed non-mushy even served with syrup already on it.   The review got knocked down for 2 reasons: the staff seemed unorganized and flustered which led to below average service and everyone's food at my table came out cold.

KYeRT-Wr3aa-8DKNky_nEw.text: Dark sports bar atmosphere that brought the flavor! Why, why must you have sweet potato fries on the menu, then I have to order them! Damn they were good. The veggie burger has all the flavor your could ever want, looks great - but didn't quite pass the texture test - a bit soft and did not stay together as a patty. Easy downtown location, great service and welcoming - vibe of a good local lunch spot.

oi09C6YYEWYeJ9nDhSzNLw.text: An honest 3.5 stars for August Henry's. While the food is decent, it's a little pricey for what you're getting. The menu consists of typical American bar food like burgers and sandwiches so I never really thought to stop in because there are so many other similar options downtown.   I stopped in for lunch and opted for the Sweet Potato Chicken Salad, and while the serving appeared large, I'm not sure if it really was that large, considering it only came with one piece of chicken breast. I'm perfectly ok with small portions, but I hate seeing places charge so much for a plate of lettuce. The salad was $12. Ok enough about how cheap I am and onto my tastebuds; it tasted so good! The fried sweet potato shreds added a crunchy and sweet element to the salad that I've never seen in other salads anywhere else. Such a unique flavor profile and the chicken was prepared perfectly. The flavor makes up for the price! However, was it the best salad I've ever had? No and it certainly wasn't the worst. Overall, it was decent.   When I stopped in at 11:30, the place was empty but it quickly filled up to capacity by noon so I recommend making reservations for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of August Henry's Burger Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sweet Potato Chicken Salad

aiCkD1W9EarjDRwQwAioZQ.text: So I am in the middle when it comes to this place. The food is ok, the service is always good, but the prices are pretty high for the food you're getting. The best thing I have had while here was the Chicken and waffles. Had perfectly breaded chicken with a sweet sriracha sauce and maple syrup on top of a waffle. Can't really go wrong with chicken and waffles though.. The buffalo dip is always really good as well. Service was good last time we visited, the waitress was even really nice and gave us a coupon that was bogo. All in all, I wouldn't go out of my way to come here. Especially with Sienna or Bakersfield close by.

2tMUI2vDijpACRf4_ydMCA.text: Nice bar with a lot of different food options! They had a pretty extensive cocktail & beer menu as well. Service was quick and friendly.  We started with the Buffalo chicken dip which is so good! It was a HUGE portion So be ready to share with your whole table!! So many of the appetizers looked good. I cannot wait to go back and try the others.  For my main course I had the chicken potstickers because they are rare to find. They were yummy and so was the sauce they came with. However they were a little over fried. The fries my mom & husband both got were way too overcooked. They were beyond crispy and almost inedible. Other than that everyone really liked their meals.  I will be back again to try something different off the menu! Overall a good experience.

Food stored in cooler for days wings preheated after sitting days. managers are a joke  racist against blacks.. rat infested droppings ever we're dirty kitchen place is a joke honestly my opinion

uGMK8gyNgg_QpxajzaW6Dg.text: Not perfect but a solid bar.  Came here before a pirates game after struggling to find a place to eat and drink.  The pierogis are top notch and I liked the drink options.  The only problem is this bar is surrounded by better options.

a3Yoh9ltJS2mO89hYNxqrA.text: We had a terrible experience at August Henry's last night. Its a shame because they have so much potential just with location alone - they need to step it up with all of the competitors near by. Here is a list of things that were just awful.  *The drinks- I ordered a margarita, and it was not a margarita. It was orange/brown. It was so sour I could barely drink it. It was a mix of orange juice and lime juice- with a hint of tequila. With rotten fruit in it. * The service- the worst service I've ever seen! we were only the 3rd table in the place all night- and it took forever to get our drinks and food. The bartenders would not make our drinks- we watched them and the manager just sit there on their phones and talk. They would make our waitress make and get our drinks for us, but the problem was, our waitress was outside smoking cigarettes and on her cell phone right in front of our window the whole night.  * The food- cold and just not good.  We just wanted out of there, but we couldn't because nobody would even bring us our bill. We had to ask for it twice. Keep in mind we were only the 3rd table they had all night.

photos.caption: Photo of August Henry's Burger Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

jV74ZthhsGAOiqjDPkdDiw.text: August Henry's has never really been on my radar. It's surrounded by all the super trendy Penn Ave restaurants that people are currently drooling over. So when we opted out of long waits at a few other nearby places and stopped in for a late dinner, I wasn't sure what to expect.  Pleasantly surprised. It's an old style pub and that's really the atmosphere. Plenty of TVs around the bar. They had a $6 Long Island Iced Tea special, so I jumped right on that. Unfortunately it wasn't very good. I wanted to order pierogies, but they had run out. Ended up going with the Chipotle Burger and it was on point. Actually, if I ever wanted a burger after a game, I'd probably go here again. It was just a fun atmosphere. People were drinking, laughing, and enjoying themselves.   So despite the fact that it's not utilizing the barn wood, galvanized tin, industrial interior design trends like the neighboring restaurants. The food is decent, service was good, and they have a nice drink selection. Nothing fancy, or pretentious like the surrounding options. It was simple, fun, and easy. Nice pub atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of August Henry's Burger Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chipotle Burger and Sweet Potato Fries

hNfcS2zt7EhqrlPqHJgwsA.text: Very slow service. Don't go there unless you have time to wait an hour for your simple sandwich. Sandwiches we're cold and very dry. Not worth the visit, try somewhere else in the area.

uawoAAguJgtOgQykDgIKfA.text: BEST STEAKS, CRAB CAKES and BURGERS.  There it was - the trifecta of greatness in these three items that this establishment claimed they were BEST.   Best means no one is better. That means upscale steak spots. Mid level restaurants. The bottom dwellers. August Henry laid down the claim - and I accepted the challenge to find out the truth.  My lady and I went across the street from the Courtyard since the reviews looked ok and they had what I wanted - a steak.   We started with Makers Mark old fashioned's. Not a good start. At least they tried.   We then tried some buffalo wings as we were hungry from a long ride across the state. Average at best.  The Caesar salad that came with my meal was DRENCHED in creamy dressing. Ridiculous.   My lady had a steel city burger -cheddar, onions and mushrooms. She liked it.The accompanying onion rings were definitely frozen.   The strip steak was nothing close to the best. Reminded me of a Ponderosa steak from that bad chain that went out of business. No way was this aged. The meat was tough. Not seasoned. Bennigans or TGI Fridays do a better job and that's NOT a compliment. The baked potato was cold.  Service was fair.   Of this I am certain - I will never return to this restaurant.

Only got six, twelve would have been too much.  I also ordered the turkey bacon burger. Very tasty, not at all bland like some turkey burgers. Side of gator tots were...yummy. 8XD0QzAXi1JkcQpJtajI_Q.text: My husband and I came here on a Saturday night to use a coupon from the enjoy book. There were very few customers seated throughout the restaurant and only a handful sitting at the bar. I was surprised as it was the start of college football with Pitt and the Pirates playing in town.   We were seated at a high top located by the windows looking out to the street. Our waiter was serving everyone in the restaurant but was quick to take our order. They have decent Saturday specials, including $6 Long Island Ice Tea, $6 Buffalo Chicken Dip, and $5 Soft Pretzels and Cheese. We went with the soft pretzels for an appetizer and I ordered a side of honey mustard as I am not a fan of cheese. The pretzels were nice and crisp on the outside, soft and fluffy on the inside, and were lightly salted. The honey mustard was very thick but tasted delightful - I have a feeling it was made in house! Overall, this was a pleasant, hearty start to dinner.   For my entree I ordered a combo meal. They have 4 or 5 options that include any combination of 2 items - 1/2 sandwich, soup, or a house or caesar salad. I went with a chicken club and the house chili. The chili came out first with cheese on top. It was nicely spiced with freshly diced peppers, onions, and tomatoes mixed in. It was slightly on the greasy side but an enjoyable bite. Then, my sandwich came out. It was hardly a half a sandwich with very little chicken comparedcto amount of bread. The bread was toasted but almost too hard around the edges. The chicken was as dry as it can get. I ended up slathering extra honey mustard from the pretzels on it. There was supposed to be an avocado spread but there was very little, I could not taste it. The other 3/4 of my platter was covered with crispy, greasy housemade chips. I enjoyed them but felt my arteries clogging with each bite.   The service was decent. We were almost done with our meal before our waiter came back to check on us but in the meantime another employee had refilled our water and cleared plates when necessary. They worked as a team even though there were not mamy customers.   Price wise, the deals were good and we made out well with our coupon. However, full price prices were a bit high for the quality of the food we experienced. It wouldn't turn us away from coming downtown for a special every now and then.  Overall, this place is alright. If you are looking for average bar food, it is an ok option with city prices.

photos.caption: Photo of August Henry's Burger Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Half a Chicken Club with housemade chips. Not pictured - chili
Photo of August Henry's Burger Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pretzels and Cheese

KPMZx-3miBTL2ueOyF9oRg.text: Came here for the first time for lunch.  I ordered the Shriracha chicken mac n' cheese bowl.  My friends ordered the pulled pork mac n' cheese bowl, the fish n chips, and a build a burger, and the pretzel breadstick appetizer.  What's Hot - Service.  Our waitress routinely checked in on us.  For my drink, I ordered a hot water with lemon (that's what happens when your cold starts developing).  My hot water came in a small coffee mug.  The waitress continually checked in on me to make sure I had enough hot water and if I needed a refill.  She said she knows the cup is small, which is why she was checking.  When we asked for hot sauce, she brought us two options- Tabasco and another brand.  She split our checks and made sure we had everything we needed.  She was very attentive and helpful.  Awesome job! - Location.  Convenient downtown location.  The layout of the restaurant is pretty nice, too.  There's a bar with big screen TVs for the sports lovers.  High tables with high chairs and regular sit down tables.  I wouldn't recommend groups larger than four, because it doesn't look like their table layouts are equipped for that.    - Menu variety.  Pretty straightforward layout- front and back page of a menu.  Not too complicated.  It looks like there's something for everyone- soups, salads, appetizers, sandwiches, and burgers.   - Quality.  The pretzel breadstick appetizer was probably the best.  Warm, soft, and chewy served with melted nacho cheese.  My mac n' cheese came with a yummy cheese bread that was freshly melted and warm.  My friends liked their dishes, as well.  No complaints.   - Price.  Reasonable prices for what you're getting.  What's Not - Location.  Parking in the area is not easy to come by, nor is it free or cheap. - Flavor/quality of food.  To be fair, it's not like the food sucked, but I've had better.  For example, my Sriracha mac n' cheese bowl wasn't spicy.  I like spicy food- hence why I specifically ordered the Sriracha mac n' cheese.  But there was barely a kick.  Additionally, I found a couple chunks/pieces of cheese in my mac n' cheese, which leads me to think that their mac n' cheese is more than likely zapped in a microwave and not necessarily anywhere near freshly made.  The food isn't bad, but I've had better.    Final Answer Would be willing to come back.  Would not be my first choice, but not bad for what you're getting.

photos.caption: Photo of August Henry's Burger Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pulled pork Mac n cheese bowl
Photo of August Henry's Burger Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sriracha chicken Mac n cheese bowl

GNYOCrOOqYeJAz4kFVERfQ.text: I've been here a few different times , mostly in the bar area. Food is decent , one of my favorite Caesar salads . Bartenders always seem nice enough , no complaints on their drinks . Didn't care for one of employees attitudes when he exclaimed that he needed to take our plate in order to leave his shift so he could go out . I'm in the restaurant industry and would never imagine saying that (at least out loud )! Other than that, it's a good pub to try in the city .

J0ZRI0_gS8VSyaJMFHEUVA.text: I wasn't hungry enough to try one of their burgers, but I'll definitely go back and try one next time (I've heard they're great and they say they're a burger bar, so...). However, I love that I got to try things on the menu I wouldn't have tried otherwise.  My friend and I split the quesadilla and Buffalo chicken dip and they were both delicious. The Buffalo chicken dip comes with baby naan! And if you run out, they'll bring you more. The naan minis are delicious and could easily be eaten on their own. The dip and quesadilla were also very good.  Our service was AMAZING. Kristy was very helpful, and brought our drinks and food quickly. She wasn't hovering or there TOO much, but was always there when we needed her. Ask for Kristy when you go to August Henry's. She was wonderful and very friendly.  The happy hour prices are also killer. $3 drinks (including Captain and other name brands - not just well), wines (generous pours from what I saw), & beers (don't know the lists there, since I don't drink beer and didn't really pay attention). Plus, you can get happy hour prices ANYWHERE in the restaurant. We did not sit in the bar. I'll definitely go back to August Henry's. I look forward to our next visit!

tC_tQI9tpaC0IP9KkS0EOA.text: I stopped here for lunch on a Tuesday for lunch. There was a short wait, but we were seated quickly. Once seated we did have to wait quite some time to order and then the food took 30 minutes to come out. For weekday lunch dining that was way too long.   The brisket Mac and cheese was delicious. I could only finish half of the huge serving. I think they do everything big here. My friend's salad was massive and the soda servings we're at least 20oz cups. I had to use to hands to hold the cup .  I would try to come again during different hours. The price was great for the size and quality.

G3X4GDBHEH4Qwt7WAKFAPg.text: Walking around the area, actually looking for a different restaurant but when I stopped there, they were out of the one food I wanted to order. So, not knowing where to go I continued to walk aimlessly until coming up to August Henry's Burger Bar. It has a nice exterior. When you walk in, it is a traditional bar and grill.  I was seated right away at a hightop. (It was only me.) The server brought me a menu and I ordered a beer while I looked. I was intrigued by what they called the Gus's Burger. It looked like it would be large, cost almost twice the others on the menu and came with a t-shirt. My first thought was even if I couldn't eat it all, the burger plus the t-shirt was a pretty good deal, and I would go back to Chicago with a souvenir.  Then I saw the burger in a Yelp photo. Nope. It looks like it is about 9 inches tall or perhaps more. Way too much - knowing me, I'd try to eat the whole thing and be sick the rest of the night.  I ended up getting a "build your own" burger and fries. The food arrived very quickly. This was probably easily 1/2 pound burger on a pretzel bun. Standard, it comes with lettuce, tomato, and onions. For extra $$ you can add other toppings. The burger was done exactly as ordered, the vegetables were fresh, the bun very good. And, the fries were hand cut and quite tasty. I should have ordered them crisp (my preference) but they were still very good.  Even though I didn't get to try the one restaurant I wanted to and I leave tomorrow afternoon so won't be able to on this visit, I'm really glad I ended up here. Kudos to the servers and the chef. Great dinner.

TXMKBOs00Ui2Uq1YOLOEeA.text: I visited August Henry's before a Pens game and I have to say, I was underwhelmed. The only way I can truly describe it is mediocre.   It was happy hour and it was nice to have a variety of house wines and drafts on special. I ordered the chicken salad and it was fine, but nothing to stand out. Others at my table reported that the chili was just ok and the general tsos chicken sandwich fell short. Unfortunately, at cultural district prices, I expect more. Service was fine but not a place I'm in a hurry to head back to.

CrxGr_Y3oj5Ek76aMci34A.text: While in Pittsburgh asked the hotel front desk staff for a recommendation for a good burger and they recommended August Henry's. I really enjoyed the burger! You can make your burger however you want. It was delicious and the onion rings with horsey sauce was so good! I did overhear people complaining that the restaurant did not offer entries, it's a burger bar, if you take it for what it is I think most will enjoy the casual atmosphere.
